original: A letter from Kaetlynn to Uhtred
string: 凯特琳致乌瑟雷德的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
My dearest Uhtred, 
	
	I knew I would find you eventually. Over the years, I've always felt your presence during my evening walks in the city. I finally saw you at the entrance to the Temple of Talos in Markarth, but when I got there, you were gone. I don't understand why. What do you want me to do? How can I see you again? Is the Temple of Talos the answer? Is that why you stood before its doors? Oh Uhtred, why do you haunt me in this way? I want to see you again and speak to you, my love. However, you've given me an epiphany. While renovating the Pump Station into a Tavern and proper Dwelling, I discovered a hidden chamber housing a dormant steam-powered Dwemer construct, which Katria said is a Centurion, and was very dangerous, so we left it alone to be delt with later. I found some men who I hired to deal with the Centurion. They were able to lure it into the well room while trying to attack them. It chased them around the well until it stumbled upon the circular stairs there and toppled over, falling to it's own destruction. I will hire a mason to convert the centurions housing chamber into a new Temple. Then a sculptor who can agree to be discreet to sculpt a statue of Talos for the Temple. My hopes are that you'll come to me here, in the home I've built for us. I'll have to instruct Katria to never disclose this plan of mine to my sister Kara, she would think I've gone insane chasing your ghost. Oh how I wish the two of you got along better. I will end this for now and make some plans. I love you, Uhtred.

- Your Kaetlynn, always and forever
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
​​致我最亲爱的乌特雷德：​​

我早知终会寻到你踪迹。这些年每当我漫步城中暮色，总能感受到你的存在。直到那日在马卡斯城的塔洛斯神殿门前，我终于真真切切看见了你的身影——可待我赶到时，你却消散无踪。为何如此？要我如何做才能再见你一面？莫非塔洛斯神殿就是答案？所以你才显现在那扇门前？乌特雷德啊，为何要这样折磨我？我多想再与你相视而语，吾爱。不过你倒点醒了我。改建泵站为酒馆时，我发现个暗室，里头沉睡着台蒸汽动力的锻莫机械——卡提雅说那是台百夫长，危险得很，我们便暂未处置。后来我雇人将那铁疙瘩引至井室，它追着他们绕井狂奔，结果在环形阶梯处栽倒，自我了断了。我打算请石匠把那间机械室改造成新神殿，再找个嘴严的雕刻师塑尊塔洛斯神像。盼你能来此寻我，在这个我亲手打造的家里。得嘱咐卡提雅别向她姑妈卡拉透露这事，否则她定以为我追着亡魂发癫。唉，真希望你俩能处好些...暂且搁笔，我得去筹备了。

永远爱你的凯特琳。
</font>

original: A letter from Kaetlynn to Uhtred
string: 凯特琳致乌瑟雷德的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
Uhtred,

Another toast... alone... to you my dearest there in Sovngarde. I've stocked up on mostly wine. You know my taste for mead only goes so far. But wine! Oh, there is such a variety. Sometimes it's difficult to choose which one to drink. I ask you, but you never answer... I pray you're not angry with me. The wine dulls your absence and helps me pretend you're still here. I miss you so much, that I just can't bear it at times. You've been gone for almost two decades now and I still often cry myself to sleep. I pray to Talos the divines will allow a Breton like me to go to Sovngarde so that I can finally be with my husband once again. I miss you so much and still love you Uhtred.

- Your Kaetlynn
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
​​乌特雷德：​​

又一次独自举杯...敬身在​​松加德​​的你。如今酒窖里多是葡萄酒，你知道我对蜜酒向来兴趣有限。但葡萄酒啊——品类繁多，有时真让人挑花了眼。我总问你该选哪瓶，你却从不应答...但愿你不是在生我的气。酒能麻痹思念，让我假装你仍在身旁。二十年了，我仍时常哭着入睡。祈求​​塔洛斯​​垂怜，让我这个​​布莱顿人​​死后也能踏入​​松加德​​，与我的丈夫重逢。至死爱你。

​​你的凯特琳​
</font>

original: Note found on Taron Dreth
string: 在泰荣·德莱瑟身上发现的笔记

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='18'>
Taron, 

     Apparently, you're being hunted by the Inquisitors of Candor. One from their order came here and had the audacity to threaten me for answers regarding your location and especially that of your colleague Katria, whom he said has been missing. You told me she was visiting a relative in High Rock. For that answer, I was violently struck across my face with the back of his gauntlet, telling me that's a flat-out lie! 

  Look here Taron, I and my Thalmor fought and wounded the daedroth but couldn't kill him. After the bastard killed 3 of my men and 4  Markarth city guards he disengaged combat, calmly walked away like we were nothing, and entered the excavation. Apparently, they suspect you of foul playl! Now I have an Inquisitor here searching through Nchuand-Zel for Katria. 

I'd suggest you hire bodyguards and lay low for a while. These Inquisitors fight like Daedra. Henceforth, the Thalmor and I want nothing to do with you. Your services are no longer required. We do not associate with low-life criminals or murderers!

- Ondolemar 
Head Justiciar, Understone Keep in Markarth
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='18'>
泰荣，

     很显然，你正在被坎多的审判者追捕。他们手下的一个人来了，还厚颜无耻地威胁我要我告诉你你的位置尤其是你的同事卡提雅的位置，他说她失踪了。你跟我说她去高岩看望看亲戚了。因为这个答案，我被他的手套背面狠狠地打了一巴掌，他告诉我这是一个彻头彻尾的谎言!

听着，泰荣，我和我的梭默朋友战斗并伤害了那个该死的，但没能杀死他。在那个混蛋杀了我的3个手下和4个马卡斯城的守卫之后，他退出了战斗，平静地离开了，好像我们什么都不是一样，然后进入了挖掘场。显然，他们怀疑你有问题!所以现在有一个审判者在楚安德-泽尔寻找卡提雅。

我建议你雇个保镖，躲一阵子。这些审判者战斗起来像迪德拉一样。从今以后，梭默和我不想再和你有任何瓜葛。我不再需要你的服务了。我们不与低级罪犯或杀人犯打交道!

- 昂多勒马
马卡斯的石下要塞的首席法官
</font>

original: A letter from Kaetlynn to Uhtred
string: 凯特琳致乌瑟雷德的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
My dearest Uhtred,

The hole in my heart grows every day. I fear it will consume me out of loneliness without you by my side. I've no desire to do anything anymore. I can't remember the last time that I ate anything. Our lovely daughter, Katria, is no longer the seven-year-old little girl you left behind with me in Windhelm. She has grown into a lovely young lady. She's full of spirit... your spirit I'm afraid, I can feel it in her. She's quite the explorer and loves Dwemer ruins, though I fear and pray to Talos for her safety every time she dwells within them. She's read certain passages from her college books to me here at the house about weird things the Dwemer left behind. Like, deadly automatons and traps. She worries me so, because like you, she never listens to me when it comes to such matters, telling me she's an expert and knows what to look for. But still, I worry, what mother wouldn't?

- Your loving wife, Kaetlynn
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
我最亲爱的乌特雷德：

心中的空洞与日俱增。我害怕没有你在身边，孤独会将我吞噬。对任何事都提不起兴致，甚至记不清上次进食是什么时候。我们可爱的女儿卡提雅，早已不是你留在风盔城时那个七岁的小女孩了。她出落成亭亭玉立的姑娘，骨子里却继承了你那股倔劲——我能感觉到。她痴迷探索锻莫遗迹，每次她钻进那些废墟，我都向塔洛斯祈祷她的安全。她常在家里给我念学院教材里关于锻莫造物的章节，那些致命的自动机械和陷阱。就像当年的你，她总说自己是专家知道分寸，可哪个母亲能不担心呢？

——爱你的妻子 凯特琳
</font>

original: Kingsley House Receipt of Purchase
string: 金斯利宅邸购买收据

original:
Markarth Landowner Contract by Raerek, Jarl Igmund's Steward of Markarth Understone Keep, Markarth

eceipt of Purchase

This is a Contract for Purchase of a Markarth Dwemer storage area, it's ancient well, and connected chambers and tunnels known as the Nchuand-Zel Pump Station to be converted into Kingsley House family residence. Seller: Igmund, Jarl of Markarth and the Reach Purchaser: Kaetlynn Kingsley of Camlorn in High Rock Terms of the purchase are held and bound by this contractual agreement between the purchaser and the seller. The purchaser agrees to pay 25,000 septims for the property and adhere to the terms herein this contract. 1. All Dwemer artifacts discovered are to be delivered to Calcelmo, lead historian of all research being conducted at the excavation site of the Markarth archaeological dig of Nchuand-Zel. 2. The purchaser waves all property rights to ancient Dwemer artifacts discovered on the premises and agrees to refrain from seeking profit, notoriety, or renown from said items. 3. The purchaser agrees to never publish any literary works regarding the Dwemer Pump Station's former usage or any derived connection from the natural spring being the sole source of water for Nchuand-Zel. 4. Employment of staff, such as maids, couriers, maintenance workers, demolition teams or construction workers will be paid for soley by the purchaser. 5. The purchaser agrees to absorb all costs for the conversion of the former Pump Station's environs, it's enormous well, and its storage rooms into a new Markarth residence, without any financial support from Markarth's Jarl or treasury. 6. The purchaser acknowledges this is also a non-disclosure agreement to withhold all information of and in this contract from the Aldmeri Dominion, Altmer in general, and more specifically, Ondolemar, or any Justiciar, and the Thalmor. The consequences of failing any part of this contract will render it null and void, the property confiscated, fined 50 thousand septims, and the purchaser sentenced to the Cidhna mine, for no less than ten years, even with good behavior. Signed this 22nd day of Frostfall 4E 176

Kaetlynn Kingsley of Camlorn, High Rock Igmund, Jarl of Markarth
string:
马卡斯城地契契约 立约人：马卡斯总管拉雷克 地点：马卡斯城石下要塞

地产购置凭证

本合同将恩查德-泽尔泵站（含上古锻莫储藏区、古井及相连隧道）转让为金斯莱家族宅邸。 卖方：马卡斯领主伊格蒙德 买方：高岩省卡姆洛恩的凯特琳·金斯莱 买方支付25，000赛普汀并遵守以下条款： 1. 所有发现的锻莫文物须移交至卡尔塞尔莫——恩查德-泽尔考古发掘项目首席历史学家。 2. 买方须放弃对房产范围内发现的锻莫古物的所有权，并承诺不以任何形式通过上述物品谋取利益、名声或荣誉。 3. 买方承诺永不发表任何关于锻莫泵站历史用途的著作，亦不得公开其与恩查德-泽尔唯一水源自然泉眼的关联性研究。 4. 所有雇佣人员（包括女仆、信使、维修工、拆迁队及建筑工人）费用均由买方独立承担。 5. 买方须自行承担将泵站设施（含巨型水井及储藏室）改建为马卡斯住宅的全部费用，马卡斯领主及金库不予财政支持。 6. 本契约同时作为保密协议，买方须向先祖神州、高等精灵（特别是审判官奥恩多莱马尔）及梭默组织隐瞒契约所有内容。 违约将导致：地产没收、50，000赛普汀罚款及至少十年希德娜矿场苦役。 签署于第四纪元176年霜落月22日

高岩省卡姆洛恩 凯特琳·金斯莱 马卡斯领主 伊格蒙德

original: Kara's Letter to Katria
string: 卡拉致卡提雅的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>
My dear Katria, 

Going by your last letter to me, I trust that you're in good health and spirit both. I am simply in awe of your commitment to your work researching dwemer architecture and history. Truly, your sense of duty you get from your mother, Kaetlynn, my sister. While obviously you get your desire for exploration and survival skills from your father Uhtred. Stendarr rest both their souls. 

Did your mother ever tell you, she overheard Ulfric telling some of his men, he thought your father could be the Shezarrine of the 4th era? This reverie of Ulfric's quite possibly lead to your father's death. I know Uhtred was an exceptional warrior, and then some, but he wasn't the Shezarrine no more than he was the Dragonborn. I curse Ulfric for using Uhtred as the right hand of the divines,  constantly placing your father in the most difficult conflicts imaginable. Your mother used to tell me that Uhtred had a knack for beating the odds until the bitter end in that Markarth Incident. Apologies Katria, I know you loved your father and that his demise under Ulfric disturbs you, as it should. 

I remember the letter from you mother telling me that she had finally had enough of the Stormcloaks, the civil war and Ulfric. She wanted nothing to do with that life after she lost your father. She only wanted to be close to your father's spirit and could only imagine that place to be where he finally fell in battle. It was the whole reason behind her move to Markarth. Even though your father would have been furious about the notion. She told me she was killing two birds with one stone. She said, on one hand, she believed she could feel Uhtred's presence in Markarth, while on the other hand, what better way was there to escape, than to live amongst Ulfric's enemies. It was a shame really, but I could not talk her out of it. 

Living in Markarth, she thought it best to drop your fathers surname Beinbroti and return to using her maiden name of Kingsley to remain hidden from the Stormcloaks and Ulfric's influence. She knew all too well that Ulfric too, would be extremely putout to learn the spouse of his former Bonebreaker was in self exile in Markarth. 

Ulfric was unwise to exhaust your father's reserves in his exploits. Your father deserved better then Ulfric, he was a true Nord hero. But I digress, these are matters you are already well aware of. 

So, did you finally clear out all the cobwebs in that hidden shrine to Talos your mother 'claimed' she found. I know my sister and when she's fabricating a story for me. You can tell me Katria, I wont let it come back on you. Well anyway, if true, Stendarr knows, if it's as big as you say, your father would have loved that shrine were he still alive. Your mother told me once she thought the chambers might have been used for something else, something older. Who, in their right mind, would have paid a hadsome commission to have it built in the first place, and in an old Dwemer Pump Station no less? It's absolutely insane, the person must have been flat out stupid drunk. 

...Speaking of which, now that I've brought it up writing about it, this makes me wonder if it wasn't your mother afterall, on a bender, trying to honor your father's memory some how. She missed Uhtred so very much, I know that's why she drank herself into Oblivion. To cope with despression, it was clearly the death of her. After all these years, I'm still so sorry Katria, that I couldn't have done more for your mother, my sister... so sad... 

On another topic, have you had any recent luck in your search for that mysterous dwemer forge? I do love hearing about your delvings and spelunking into those ancient dwemer ruins. Although I have to admit there's an overwhelming sense of anxiety reading your letters. Weirdly addictive as well. But then I always simply love hearing from you Katria. Please write back soon I await with anticipation.

With sincere Love and adoration, your aunt Kara
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>
​​致亲爱的卡提雅：

看了你上次的来信，知道你现在身体和精神状态都不错，我就放心啦！你研究锻莫建筑和历史的那股认真劲儿，简直跟你妈凯特琳（我那个倔妹妹）一模一样。至于你那爱冒险的性子嘛，肯定是遗传自你爸乌特雷德。愿斯坦达尔保佑他们的灵魂。

你的妈妈跟你说过没？她曾亲耳听见乌弗瑞克跟手下吹嘘，说你爸可能是第四纪元的谢尔格拉化身。就因为这荒唐念头，害得你爸送了命。我知道乌特雷德是个了不起的战士，但他既不是什么神选者，更不是龙裔。我诅咒乌弗瑞克把你爸当"神之右手"使唤，总把他往最危险的战场上推。你妈常说，你爸总能在绝境中创造奇迹，直到马卡斯事件那次...抱歉提起这些，卡提雅，我知道你有多爱你爸，也理解你对乌弗瑞克的恨意。

我还记得你妈妈写给我的那封信，说她终于受够了风暴斗篷、内战和乌弗瑞克。失去你父亲后，她再也不想和那种生活有任何瓜葛。她只想离你父亲的灵魂近一些，觉得只有在他战死的地方才能感受到他的存在。这就是她搬去马卡斯的全部原因。虽然你父亲要是知道了肯定会大发雷霆。她说这是一举两得：一方面她相信在马卡斯能感受到乌特雷德的存在，另一方面，还有什么比躲在乌弗瑞克的敌人堆里更好的藏身之处呢？虽然我觉得很遗憾，但实在劝不动她。

住在马卡斯那会儿，她觉得最好让你改回她的娘家姓金斯莱，这样既能避开风暴斗篷的耳目，又能躲开乌弗瑞克的影响。她太清楚了——要是让那家伙知道他昔日的"碎骨者"之妻，如今竟自我放逐到敌营马卡斯，非得气炸肺不可！

乌弗瑞克不明智地耗尽了你父亲的精力在他的征战中。你父亲值得比乌弗瑞克更好的对待，他是个真正的诺德英雄。不过我离题了，这些事情你都再清楚不过了。

对了，你妈妈"偶然发现"的那个塔洛斯密室，蜘蛛网扫干净没？我了解我妹妹，她编故事给我听的时候是什么样子。你可以告诉我实情，卡提雅，我不会说出去的。好吧，如果那是真的，斯坦达尔知道，如果它真像你说的那么大，你父亲要是还活着一定会喜欢的。你母亲曾跟我说过，她认为那个密室可能曾被用作其他用途，更古老的用途。哪个神志清醒的人会花大价钱在一个老旧的锻莫泵站里建造这种东西？这简直太疯狂了，那人一定是喝得烂醉如泥。

...说到这个，既然都写到这儿了，我不禁怀疑：该不会真是你母亲某次喝高了，想用这种方式纪念你父亲吧？她太想念乌特雷德了，我知道这就是她酗酒至死的原因。为了逃避抑郁，这显然要了她的命。这么多年过去了，卡提雅，我还是很抱歉没能为你母亲——我的妹妹——多做些什么...太令人难过了...

换个话题，你最近在找那个神秘的锻莫熔炉有什么进展吗？我超爱听你讲探索那些古老锻莫遗迹的故事。不过说实话，每次看你的信都让我提心吊胆的，但又莫名上瘾。总之我就是特别喜欢收到你的消息，卡提雅。快点回信啊，我都等不及了！

​​永远爱你的姨母 卡拉​
</font>

original: Katria's First Journal
string: 卡提雅的第一本日记

original:
My Journal

12th of Midyear, 4E 175 - My mother bought me this new journal as a present for my 8th birthday so that I could write down and collect notes on everything I learn about the Dwemer. Oops, I'm getting ahead of myself. [pagebreak] My name is Katria Beinbroti, but mother says I have to tell everyone my last name is Kingsley now, because we are kind of hiding from my father's old friend Ulfric and his men. Not because we're in trouble with them, but momma doesn't want to talk to them anymore. She's really mad at them for getting my father killed. I'm mad at them too. Dumb people fighting other dumb people because they never learned how to share their toys and make friends. I like Markarth, it's different here, and the snow is only up higher in the mountains, so it's a little warmer here then in Windhelm. I'm trying to get momma to take me into Understone Keep to see the researchers there digging up old stuff. I want to dig up old stuff too. 4th of Sun's Dusk, 4E 177 - Finally, momma took me to Understone Keep to meet the Jarl and some old Altmer named Calcelmo who's doing research at the dig site. At first he yelled at momma telling her it was no place for children. Then I yelled at him for yelling in the first place and asked him who he thought he was to talk to my momma like that. Then I told him he was a jerk for yelling at momma and digging up stuff in the dirt, like a dummy. I told him, if he wants to dig up dirt he needs kids like me, every one knows that kids can dig up dirt better then anyone. That's when I told him I'm still a kid so I can do that too, and that I was going to do the same thing he is doing one day but I'm going to do it better because I'm nice to people. He smiled and got a lot nicer after that, and showed me some old stuff the Dwemer made. It was a fun day after that. 26th of Heartfire, 4E 179 - Mother has been letting me explore the city as long as I behave and listen to elders and stay away from the city guards because she doesn't want them asking me questions. I found a temple to the goddess Dibella above the temple to Talos. I snuck inside just to sneak a peak as children aren't allowed without a chaperone. Oh my word, it was a naughty temple! It was chock-full of naked statues and some of the priestesses were performing some sort of ritual all naked just like the statues, they were kissing and touching each others privates, making soft moaning sounds. It was interesting but very weird and made me feel some kind of awkward. I didn't tell momma because I'm sure she would not have approved. Then I went to the dig in Understone Keep to chat with Calcelmo some more about Nchuand-Zel. It's sounds really interesting. Maybe someday I'll get to see the old city he says is inside it. 5th of Midyear, 4E 180 - Calcelmo let me borrow a stack of books on the Dwemer, he said it was only light reading. It took me over 3 weeks to absorb those books. It only made me hungry to know more. I want to learn more about some mythological mineral the Dwemer called Aetherium, and some mythological forge that they built that could get hot enough to shape the Aetherium. Calcelmo said it was a waste of time as no scholar has ever learned anything new on that topic. I'm convinced that is because scholars habitually never go anywhere without a host of other people and guards. 17th of Last Seed, 4E 181 - Today, I went to the Treasury and the Hag's Cure to gather more information about Dwemer architecture. While there, I had the pleasure of meeting another Breton woman like mother named Muiri, who kindly engaged in conversation during her lunch break and even offered me a sweet roll and a cup of steamed Apple Bourbon Cider. It was delicious! She suggested that I consider going to the College of Winterhold if I want to learn more about Dwemer history and architecture. I plan to discuss this with mother to see if we can afford it and then investigate if they have an early acceptance program. Additionally, Calcelmo expressed his belief in my passion and aptitude for Dwemer knowledge and strongly recommended that I apply to the College of Winterhold for a comprehensive education in Dwemer studies and historical subjects. Despite being only 14, he even offered to provide a reference letter to support my potential early admission to the College. 9th of Evening Star, 4E 183 - Back home on break visiting mother. She's a complete wreck. I fear her health is only declining. I'm almost finished with my first 2 years at Winterhold College. I'm foregoing most of the studies into the schools of magic in favor of majoring in Dwemer Culture and Architecture. My teacher, Professor Tolfdir said I still needed to learn the basics just to gain a passing grade from him, so I guess I'm learning basic magics next year. I'm going learn some restoration magic to see if I can help mother. 3rd of Frostfall, 4E 185 I'm so thrilled to be back home in Markarth after earning my Scholars degree in Dwemer Culture and Architecture. I recently participated in a college-sponsored expedition to an actual Dwemer ruin near Winterhold, called Alftand. However, our progress was hindered by encounters with Dwarven automatons, Falmer, and frostbite spiders. Thankfully, no one was hurt, all thanks to Tolfdir's magic, which allowed us to escape unscathed. It was incredibly exhilarating, and I'm now more determined than ever to improve my skills with the Dwemer bow that Calcelmo gave me as a going-away gift for following his advice to attend college in the first place. 19th of Sun's Dawn, 4E 189 - I learned about Dwemer disputes and infighting over Aetherium. So apparently it's more than mythical if they were fighting over it. Modern scholars know Aetherium is an extremely rare, luminescent blue crystal still found in some Dwemer ruins, while being a virtually extinct mineral. 23rd of Morning Star, 4E 190 - I'm going to write a book about the infighting that Aetherium caused the Dwemer, it could lead to or even be the missing link to their disappearance. I'll work on a name for it later. Chapter 1 The end, when it came, was swift. In the span of three short years, the great dwarven cities of Skyrim, from Markarth to the Velothi Mountains, fell before the armies of the High King. Cities that had held fast against the Nords for over a hundred years crumbled abruptly and without warning. For centuries, scholars have marveled at the sudden collapse of the Dwemer city-states. Even the Nords seem to have been taken by surprise, though their chroniclers were quick to ascribe their success to King Gellir's inspired tactics and the blessings of Shor. My research suggests a much different cause, however. In the decades preceding their fall, the dwarven cities of Skyrim had been decimated by internal disputes and infighting over a most surprising cause: Aetherium. 7th of Rain's Hand, 4E 198 - I'm distraught and laden with grief, anguish and so much sorrow. I returned home to visit mother and found her laying unresponsive and cold to the touch in her bed holding an empty bottle of wine. Her skin a deathly pallor of blue. She had evidentally just passed away days before. What am I to do now. Both of my parents are gone. The only surviving relative I have left is my aunt Kara but she's so far away in Camlorn. I must write to her right way to let her know her sister has left us to be with papa. I pray to both Stendarr and Talos that she is happier now with my father. 14th of Rain's Hand, 4E 198 - Chapter 2, Cont. info about the Dwemer infighting over Aetherium Modern scholars know Aetherium as a rare, luminescent blue crystal found in some Dwemer ruins. Most consider it little more than a curiosity, as it has proven all but impossible to work with: while it has a strong magical aura, it is alchemically inert, and no known process can enchant, smelt, mold, bind, or break it. To the dwarves, of course, such problems were merely a challenge. In the years following King Harald's reign, the Dwemer discovered a considerable source of Aetherium in their deepest delvings. An alliance of four cities, led by Arkngthamz, the great research center in the southern Reach, was formed to oversee its extraction, processing, and study, and a new 'Aetherium Forge' constructed to smelt it under precisely controlled conditions. 31st of Evening Star, 4E 199 - Chapter 3 If the inscriptions I discovered are to be believed, the results were nothing short of spectacular: the items produced by the Forge were artifacts of immense power, imbued from the moment of their creation with powerful enchantments. The dwarven alliance shattered almost immediately, as the four city-states and their rivals attempted to claim the Forge. We can only speculate that none were successful. Decades of conflict merely weakened them all, allowing for King Gellir's subsequent conquests. And though the Dwemer reclaimed most of their lands a century later, there is no evidence that they ever resumed their research on Aetherium. Perhaps the costs had just been too great. But nothing like the Aetherium Forge described in the inscriptions has ever been found within the borders of Skyrim. It may have been destroyed long ago, by the Nord invaders or the Dwemer themselves. Or perhaps it, like the secrets of Aetherium itself, still remains to be discovered. I've got a lead that takes me to Arkngthamz, so I'm heading there to see what I can find.

 [pagebreak] [pagebreak]

atria's First Journal - An appendix -

The mod author's notes on this journal, to denote when, where and why Katria's research began, however, she only makes sporadic entries every two years or so to update the journal having no foreknowledge that this particular journal woud be her first...

...among many.

[pagebreak] Timeline of Events:

4E 167 - Katria is born, daughter to Uhtred Beinbroti (of Windhelm) and Kaetlynn Kingsley (of Camlorn) 4E 174 - Ulfric Stormcloak informs Kaetlynn that Uhtred, her husband, has fallen in battle during the Markarth Incident. Katria is only 7-years-old 4E 174 - Kaetlynn, overcome with anguish, now furiously blames Ulfric for Uhtreds death, takes Katria and immediately moves to Markarth from Windhelm to be close to Uhtreds spirit and distance herself from Ulfric and war. 4E 174 - Kaetlynn buys the Nchuand-Zel Pump Station and store rooms to convert into a dwelling and a new tavern to compete with the Silver-Bloods 4E 175 - Katria starts her research notes on the Dwemer at the age of 8-years-old 4E 177 - Katria visits Understone Keep with her mother and meets Calcelmo for the first time 4E 179 - Katria at age 12 sneaks into the Temple of Dibella for the first time 4E 181 - Katria at age 14 with Calcelmo's backing is accepted and enters college at Winterhold 4E 183 - Katria adds a journal entry noticing her mother's health is declining from alcoholism 4E 185 - Katria finishes college, obtaining a Scholars degree in Dwemer Culture and Architecture 4E 185 - That same year Katria attends a college-sponsored expedition to Alftand 4E 189 - Katria learns of the Dwemer disputes over Aetherium 4E 190 - Katria makes her decision to write an assay or book upon the Dwemer disputes 4E 198 - Kaetlynn Kingsley passes away from her alcoholism while laying in bed 4E 199 - Katria hires Taron Dreth to be her assistant in Dwemer exploration 4E 199 - Katria falls to her death during an Earthquake while inside Arkngthamz 4E 200 - Kara, Katria's aunt hires 2 Inquisitor of Candor to search for Katria 4E 201 - The Dragonborn encounters Katria's Ghost in Arkngthamz and helps her find Aetherium shards and the Aetherium Forge 4E 201 - The Dragonborn encounters Taron Dreth and kills him and his guards after attempting to the Dragonborn because he knew to much about his crimes. 4E 201 - Inquistor Warren finds and retrieves Katria's corpse from Arkngthamz 4E 201 - Kara Kingsley performs the ritual to resurrect Katria 4E 201 - Kara Kingsley ports Katria home to Markarth where she visits the Silver-Blood Inn first to settle down and calm herself when she meets the Dragonborn again. Katria is now 34-years-old, (32 - discounting deceased time)
string:
我的日记

第四纪元175年年中月12日 - 母亲送我这本新日记作为八岁生日礼物，让我记录所有关于锻莫族的发现。哎呀，我写得太急了。 [pagebreak] - 我叫卡提雅·班布罗提，但母亲说现在必须对外用金斯莱这个姓氏，因为我们正在躲避父亲的老友乌弗瑞克和他的手下。倒不是惹了什么麻烦，只是母亲再也不想和他们往来——她始终无法原谅他们害死了父亲。我也恨这些蠢货，就像孩童争夺玩具般发动战争。 马卡斯城很特别，这里比风盔城暖和，只有高山顶才有积雪。我总缠着母亲带我去石下要塞看学者们挖掘古迹，我也想亲手挖出历史。 第四纪元177日暮月4日 - 终于说服母亲带我去见领主和那个叫卡塞莫的高精灵学者。他起初呵斥说考古现场不是孩子该来的地方，我就反呛他凭什么对我母亲大呼小叫，还说他像傻子一样只会挖土。我告诉他小孩才是挖土专家，总有一天我会比他更出色——不过我会对人和善。没想到他竟笑了，后来还给我展示了锻莫文物，那天真开心。 第四纪元179炉火月26日 - 母亲一直让我在城里探索，只要我表现得好，听从长辈的话，并且远离城市守卫，因为她不希望他们向我问问题。 我发现了一个供奉迪贝拉女神的庙宇，位于塔洛斯神庙之上。我偷偷溜进去，只是想偷看一眼，因为孩子没有陪同是不允许进入的。 ——天呐！那是一个肮脏的神庙，里面到处都是裸体雕像，一些女祭司和雕像一样全裸地进行着某种仪式，她们亲吻和抚摸着彼此的，发出轻柔的呻吟声。这很有趣，但非常奇怪，让我感到某种尴尬。这事当然不能告诉母亲。 后来我又去石下要塞的挖掘现场找​​卡赛莫​​聊了聊​​恩查德-泽尔​​的事。听起来真有意思，说不定哪天我真能去看看他说藏在里面的那座古城。 第四纪元180年中月5日 - 卡赛莫​​借了我一堆关于​​锻莫​​的书，还说这些只是"轻松读物"。我花了三个多星期才啃完，结果反而更渴望了解更多了。 我想研究锻莫称为​​神光水晶​​的那种传说中的矿物，还有他们建造的那个据说能熔铸神光水晶的神话熔炉。​​卡赛莫​​说这是浪费时间，因为学者们在这个课题上从没有新发现。但我敢说，这是因为那些学者出门总要带上一大帮随从和卫兵，根本没法真正探索。 第四纪元181种子月17日 - 今天，我去了​​金库​​和​​女巫药剂店​​搜集关于​​锻莫​​建筑的资料。在那里，我遇到了一位和母亲一样的​​布莱顿​​女性——​​暮蕊​​。她在午休时亲切地和我聊天，还请我吃了个甜卷饼和一杯热气腾腾的​​苹果波本酒​​，味道棒极了！她建议我，如果想深入研究​​锻莫​​历史和建筑，不妨考虑去​​冬堡学院​​。我打算和母亲商量下学费的事，再打听学院是否有少年班项目。更让我惊喜的是，​​卡赛莫​​也肯定了我对​​锻莫​​学问的热情和天赋，强烈推荐我申请​​冬堡学院​​的​​锻莫文化历史系​​。尽管我才14岁，他居然主动提出要为我写推荐信，支持我提前入学！ 第四纪元183星霜月9日 - 放假回家探望母亲，她的状况简直糟透了。眼看着她日渐憔悴，我的心揪得生疼。在​​冬堡学院​​的这两年，我几乎把所有精力都投在了​​锻莫文化与建筑学​​专业上，连基础魔法课都翘了不少。​​托夫迪尔教授​​虽然很欣赏我的论文，却板着脸说："就算你是​​锻莫​​专家，不通过基础法术考试也别想毕业。"看来明年不得不去学那些枯燥的​​恢复系魔法​​了——不过也好，说不定能找到办法帮母亲戒掉那该死的​​黑荆棘蜜酒​​... 第四纪元185霜落月3日 - 终于以​​锻莫文化与建筑学​​学者身份回到​​马卡斯城​​的家了！刚参加完学院组织的​​阿尔夫坦德​​遗迹考察——那可是​​冬堡​​附近真正的​​锻莫​​废墟！虽然途中遭遇了​​矮人机械傀儡​​、​​伐莫族​​和​​霜噬蜘蛛​​的阻挠，但多亏​​托夫迪尔​​教授的魔法护盾，我们全员毫发无损地脱险了。这种刺激感简直让人上瘾！现在我更坚定了要练好​​卡赛莫​​临别送我的那柄​​锻莫长弓的决心​​——当初要不是他极力推荐，我也不会去学院深造。每次拉弦时，弓身传来的​​齿轮嗡鸣声​​都让我想起他说过："真正的发现永远属于独行者。" 第四纪元189晨星月19日 - 最近查到了​​锻莫​​部族为争夺​​神光水晶​​爆发的内战史料。既然能引发血腥冲突，这种泛着蓝光的稀有晶体就绝不只是传说——现代学者证实，某些​​锻莫遗迹​​中仍能觅得它的踪迹，尽管作为一种近乎绝迹的矿物，它那​​幽灵般的蓝光​​如今已鲜少有人亲眼目睹。 第四纪元190年初月23日 - 我决定将​​锻莫​​因​​神光水晶​​爆发的内战写成专著——这很可能是解开他们集体消失之谜的关键线索！书名暂且未定... ​​第一章：陨落之始​​ 灭亡来得猝不及防。短短三年间，从​​马卡斯城​​到​​维洛锡山脉​​，那些曾抵御​​诺德人​​上百年的宏伟矮人城邦，竟在至高王的军队面前土崩瓦解。 几个世纪以来，学者们始终困惑于​​锻莫城邦​​的突然崩溃。连获胜的​​诺德人​​都显得措手不及，尽管他们的史官迅速将胜利归功于​​盖勒王​​的战术与​​舒尔​​的庇佑。 但我的研究指向另一个真相：在陨落前的数十年里，​​天际省​​的矮人城邦早已因争夺​​神光水晶​​而自相残杀，元气大伤。 第四纪元198雨手月7日 - 我颤抖着站在母亲的床前，整个世界天旋地转。她冰冷的手指还紧握着那个空荡荡的​​黑荆棘酒瓶​​，皮肤泛着骇人的青紫色——她已经离去许久。我现在该做什么。双亲皆逝。远在​​高岩省​​的卡拉阿姨是我最后的血亲。我必须立刻写信告知她...可羽毛笔在羊皮纸上划出的每道墨痕，都让我想起母亲教我写字时，她手上总沾着的​​炼金药剂​​味道。​​斯坦达尔​​啊，求您指引她的灵魂；​​塔洛斯​​在上，愿她终能与父亲重逢。 第四纪元198雨手月14日 ​​第二章续：神光水晶与锻莫内战​​ 现代学者仅将​​神光水晶​​视为​​锻莫遗迹​​中偶然现世的稀有蓝晶——它虽散发着强烈的魔法辉光，却无法被附魔、熔铸或分解，最终沦为实验室里的奇物标本。 但对​​锻莫​​而言，"不可能"从来都是待解的命题。在​​哈拉尔德王​​统治末期，他们于地脉最深处发现了惊人的​​神光水晶​​矿脉。以​​阿尔肯萨姆兹​​为首的四大城邦迅速结盟，在​​边塞领​​南境建立起精密控温的​​"神光水晶锻炉"​​——据残存碑文记载，当滚烫的液态水晶浇灌进模具时，整座山体都回荡着​​齿轮圣歌​​般的轰鸣。 第四纪元199星霜月31日 - 第三章 ​​若我所破译的碑文可信，​​神光水晶锻炉​​的产物堪称神迹——那些武器在诞生的瞬间就自带强大附魔。但联盟转眼分崩离析，四大城邦为争夺熔炉控制权兵戎相见。最终谁都没能得手，数十年的内战耗尽了​​锻莫​​元气，这才让​​盖勒王​​的军队有机可乘。尽管一个世纪后​​锻莫​​收复了大部分失地，却再未重启​​神光水晶​​研究。或许，那代价已沉重到连这个骄傲的种族都难以承受。 然而，碑文记载的​​神光水晶锻炉​​从未在天际境内被发现。也许它早被​​诺德人​​捣毁，或是​​锻莫​​自己亲手埋葬了这个潘多拉魔盒。又或许，就像​​神光水晶​​本身的秘密，它仍在某处静候发现—— 我的最新线索指向​​阿尔肯萨姆兹​​，明日就启程前往。

 [pagebreak] [pagebreak]

original: Letter found on Inquisitor's corpse
string: 在审判者尸体上发现的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>To Stendarr's Inquisitors of Candor

This letter is for Inquisitors Warren and Belog.

My name is Kara Kingsley, Matriarch of the Kingsley estate here in Camlorn within the Glenumbra region of High Rock, and a former High Priestess of Stendarr. I'm the sole surviving relative of a well-educated young lady by the name of Katria, daughter of my sister Kaetlynn Kingsley and one Uhtred Beinbroti of Windhelm. Beinbroti is the old Atmoran tongue or Bonebreaker in today's dialect. I digress...

After sending out inquires to Daggerfall and locally here in Camlorn the two of you came highly recommended, not only as just and honorable inquisitors but as exceptional professionals who can handle themselves when need demands it. I wish to retain both of you for investigative services for which I will provide a generous annual tithing to your order. I need you to either find my missing niece, or at the least what has happened to her. 

I'm at my wit's end with worry and anxiety. I know something is amiss with my niece, aside from her being missing, I do fear the worse. I have evidence that she may have been murdered, which is why I am invoking the tenants of your order.

She was writing a book called The Aetherium Wars, still unpublished. And recently I've obtained a published version with her apprentice being the author, yet still undoubtedly written in her style and her vernacular. My last letter from her stated she was still searching for the lost and forgotten Aetherium Forge within Dwemer ruins all over Skyrim. 

If she has indeed met her demise when you find her I will pay you double to retrieve her corpse and bring her back to me here in Camlorn of High Rock, where I reside. Please accept these septims in the amount of 1000 to be split between the two of you. Another 1000 upon your return, plus an additional 2000 if you return with her remains. 

I suspect her apprentice, a despicable Dunmer named Taron Dreth of foul play, and connected somehow to Katria's disappearance. Should you find him, I employ you to do whatever is necessary to get to the root of it all for the information. I want her found!

Sincerely, Kara Kingsley
High Priestess of Stendarr Of Camlorn, Retired 
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>致坎多的斯坦达尔审判者

这封信是写给审判者沃伦和贝洛格的。

我是卡拉·金斯利，高岩省格伦布拉区凯姆洛恩城金斯利庄园的女族长，曾是斯坦达尔的高级女祭司。本人是卡提雅，一位受过良好教育的年轻女士她唯一在世的亲戚，她是我姐姐凯特琳·金斯利和来自风舵城的乌特雷德·本布罗提的女儿。本布罗提是古老的阿特莫拉发音，在今天的方言中叫碎骨者。我离题了...

在向匕落和凯姆洛恩本地发出问询后，你们两个受到了高度推荐；不仅是作为公正和光荣的审判者，而且是可以在需要时自行处理好情势的专业人士。我希望援请你们两位开展调查服务，为此，我将每年为您的教团提供慷慨的什一奉献。我需要你找到我失踪的侄女，或者至少弄清楚她的遭遇。

我因担心和焦虑而束手无策。我知道侄女的事情有些不对劲，除了失踪之外，我确实担心更糟的事情发生在她身上。我有证据表明她可能已被谋杀，这就是我联络你的教团的原因。

她正在写一本名为神光之战的书，尚未出版。最近我得到了一个已出版的版本，以她的徒弟为作者，但毫无疑问这仍然是以她的风格和习惯写的。她寄来给我的最后一封信说，她仍在天际各地的锻莫废墟中寻找，搜寻遗失在历史中的神光水晶熔炉。

如果你找到她时她真的死了，我付给你双倍的钱来取回她的遗体，并把她带回到高岩的凯姆洛恩城给我。除了这些已交由你们两人平分的一千金币之外，回来时再付给一千，如果你带着她的遗体回来，再额外加两千。

我怀疑她的徒弟，一个卑鄙的暗精灵，名叫泰荣·德莱瑟的，在其中搞鬼，并在一定程度上与卡提雅的失踪有关。如果你找到他，我要求你去做任何必要的事情来获得情报，寻根究底。我要找到她！

真诚的，卡拉·金斯利
高岩省，格伦布拉区，凯姆洛恩城。
</font>

original: Note found on Inquisitor's corpse
string: 在审判者的尸体上发现的字条

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='18'>
Inquisitor Belog, 

    'Tis mine uttermost, sincere wish this note find thee in good measure, good health, and in the good grace of our lord Stendarr. All praise be unto Stendarr the Righteous, Stendarr the Merciful... etcetera, etcetera. 

  Belog, ye olde dog, mine friend! Hopefully thou hast regained thy vigor from oure last meeting at Madam Beaumont's Brothal, or darest I say... yonder house of wicked ill repute. Oh, if ever there wast wicked fun... surely twas had there. That ist until... what wast her name again? Brunhild, twasn't it? Broke thy nose for calling her the trollop of the eve, whilst in her drunken state she thought thou hadst called her, "the troll of the eve." Never, hast I laughed so hard in all mine years, I tell thee, I nigh shat mineself on that night. What good times indeed!

  To the crux of the matter at hand. The church hast recieved a bountiful boon from one of oure former matriarchs, Kara Kingsley of the Kingsley Estate up in Camlorn. In return for the boon she hath requested both of us by name through the church. Apparantly she doth hast a niece, sharpe in bookcraft, that lives over the Druadach mountains in Markarth in Skyrim and hast been missing for some months now. She presumes foulplay by a dunmer, one Taron Dreth. 

  Look good fellow, she's offering us 1000 septims upfront to be split twixt us both, more if we find her niece... yet even more if we retrieve her, dead or alive. 

  Meet me at the church as soon as thou doth recieve this, discussion twill be made further then.

- Inquisitor Warren, Stendarr's Inquisitors of Candor, Daggerfall
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='18'>
审判官贝洛格，

     我衷心希望收到这封信时，您身体健康，仪表风雅，沐浴着我们的主君斯坦达尔的恩眷。所有赞美都归于正义的斯坦达尔，仁慈的斯坦达尔，云云。

  好了，我的老朋友。希望你在我们上次在贝奥蒙特夫人的妓院见面之后又恢复了活力，我得说...那真是藏污纳垢之所。哦，世上如果有邪恶的乐趣，就一定会在那里。直到...再问一遍，她叫什么名字来着？布伦希尔德，是吗？她打破了你的鼻子，因为你称她为夏夜的巨魔，或者是在她醉酒的状态下，她认为你曾称她为夏夜的巨魔。我这辈子从来没有笑得这么开心过，认真的，真是美好的时光。

  说正事。教会从我们的前任女祭司之一，凯姆洛恩城金斯利庄园的卡拉·金斯利那里，得到了一笔丰厚的献金。作为回报，她通过教会点名要求我们两人去办事。事情是这样，她有一个侄女，精通文书，在天际省马卡斯附近的德鲁阿奇山上活动，现在已经失踪几个月了。她推测，是一个名叫泰荣·德莱瑟的笨蛋在搞鬼。

  好家伙，她预先给了我们一千个金币让我们平分，如果我们找到她的侄女，就有更多...如果我们把她带回来，不管是死是活，还有更多。

  收到后尽快到教堂与我会面，我们进一步讨论。

- 审判者沃伦，坎多的斯坦达尔审判者，匕落
</font>

original: A letter from Kaetlynn to Uhtred
string: 凯特琳致乌瑟雷德的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
Uhtred, my love,

I'm so eager to join you anymore... My stomach is constantly throbbing with pain these days, so I anticipate it won't be long. My only regret is leaving Katria, but she's a grown women now, more capable than I ever was at taking care of herself. And I've a feeling she'll believe I'm better off being with you, if only to calm her rational mind over the loss. She's a smart sweet roll, that daughter of ours. You'd be so very proud of her Uhtred, as I am. She'll make a fine wife someday if she ever decides to slow down to smell the mountain flowers. She told me she would find and capture one of the mechanical spider things the Dwemer left behind and tinker with it to make it a pet to watch over me while she's away. Some imagination, right? I'm going to stop writing for now, my stomach is in such pain... I need more wine. 

I love and miss you Uhtred...

- Your Kaetlynn
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
​​致乌特雷德，我的挚爱：​​

我多想早日与你相聚……这些日子胃痛日夜折磨，想来时日无多。唯一割舍不下的就是卡提雅，但她已长大成人，照顾自己比我当年强得多。这孩子理性得很，定会觉得与你团聚对我才是解脱。咱们的小甜饼多聪明啊，乌特雷德，你定会如我一般为她骄傲。若她肯停下研究嗅嗅山花，将来必是个好妻子。她竟说要抓只锻莫机械蜘蛛改造成宠物，我不在时替我守家，这丫头异想天开不是？我得搁笔了，这绞痛……得再喝点酒。

我爱你且想念你...

你的凯特琳
</font>

original: A letter from Kaetlynn to Uhtred
string: 凯特琳致乌瑟雷德的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
Uhtred... my love,

I know you will never read this now that you've gone to Sovngarde, but if I write out what's in my heart you'll somehow know it to be true. I miss you more than mere words can express. I felt an empty void growing when you left with Ulfric to fight the Forsworn and take back Markarth. On a deeper level than what I can explain, perhaps it was just a woman's intuition, but I knew something terrible was bound to happen that day. That is why I threw myself to the floor on my hands and knees clutching at your legs, begging you... pleaded with you not to go. No matter how many tears I cried you would not listen, saying you were bound to Ulfric through Nord's honor and could not deny him, nor would any true son of Skyrim. That you had to go while trying your best to assure me that everything would be alright. Oh Uhtred why did you not listen? Why could you not stay in my arms just one more day? I am lost without you... 

Always and forever, your Kaetlynn
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='16'>
乌特雷德，我的挚爱：​​

你已魂归​​松加德​​，这封信你永远无法读到……但如果我把我心里的想法写下来，或许你能感知。我对你的思念是言语无法表达的。当日你随​​乌弗瑞克​​征讨​​弃誓者​​、夺回​​马卡斯​​时，我便觉心中空洞蔓延。那非但能解释的预感——或是女子直觉——早警示我灾祸将至。所以我跪地紧抱你双腿，哭求着……哀请你别去。任我泪落成河，你仍挣脱，说着​​诺德荣誉​​，与乌弗瑞克有约，无法背弃他——"真正的​​天际之子​​岂能退缩"。你竭力安慰我一切安好，却终是离去。乌特雷德啊，你为何不听？为何不肯在我怀中多留一日？没有你，我已然迷失前路……

​​永生永世属于你的凯特琳​
</font>

original: The Aetherium Wars (2nd Edition)
string: 神光之战 (第二版)

original:
[pagebreak]

The Aetherium Wars by Katria Kingsley (The Definitive 2nd Edition) Dedicated to , my Dearist Friend and Savior Gwylim Annex Publishing, Solitude

[pagebreak]

orward

Let it be known through out all of Tamriel, that I, did witness firsthand these accounts and that this is my formal attestation. Taron Dreth, the initial author of the literary work of a previous publication under the same title as the book you now hold in your hands, was a dispicable backstabbing lier, thief, and malicious person alltogether, worthy of nothing but loathing. The true rightful author of this book is Katria Kingsley, an esteemed scholar of Dwemer Architecture and History who devoted 20 years of her life researching all the hidden clues in dusty old tomes for the location of the Aetherium Forge. Unfortunately, Katria fell to her death from a quake in Arkngthamz. It was there where I encountered her ghostly apparition when she told me of Dreth's betrayal by stealing her work and falsely publishing it under his own name. With Katria's brilliant masterful knowledge on Aetherium, we were able to locate Atherium shards together, which led to us finally locating the actual Aetherium Forge of the dwemer-folk. Best of all, we created an Aetherium artifact for proof that I now carry. Katria deserves all the credit, for my part was only to provide a physical body through which she could interact with the world. The ghoslty apparition of her presence and short companionship were extremely comfortable like old friends, and for that she is sorely missed.

[pagebreak]

The Aetherium Wars

[pagebreak]

he end, when it came, was swift. In the span of three short years, the great dwarven cities of Skyrim, from Markarth to the Velothi Mountains, fell before the armies of the High King. Cities that had held fast against the Nords for over a hundred years crumbled abruptly and without warning. For centuries, scholars have marveled at the sudden collapse of the Dwemer city-states. Even the Nords seem to have been taken by surprise, though their chroniclers were quick to ascribe their success to King Gellir's inspired tactics and the blessings of Shor. My research suggests a much different cause, however. In the decades preceding their fall, the dwarven cities of Skyrim had been decimated by internal disputes and infighting over a most surprising cause: Aetherium. Modern scholars know Aetherium as a rare, luminescent blue crystal found in some Dwemer ruins. Most consider it little more than a curiosity, as it has proven all but impossible to work with: while it has a strong magical aura, it is alchemically inert, and no known process can enchant, smelt, mold, bind, or break it. [pagebreak] To the dwarves, of course, such problems were merely a challenge. In the years following King Harald's reign, the Dwemer discovered a considerable source of Aetherium in their deepest delvings. An alliance of four cities, led by Arkngthamz, the great research center in the southern Reach, was formed to oversee its extraction, processing, and study, and a new 'Aetherium Forge' constructed to smelt it under precisely controlled conditions. If the inscriptions I discovered are to be believed, the results were nothing short of spectacular: the items produced by the Forge were artifacts of immense power, imbued from the moment of their creation with powerful enchantments. The dwarven alliance shattered almost immediately, as the four city-states and their rivals attempted to claim the Forge. [pagebreak] We can only speculate that none were successful. Decades of conflict merely weakened them all, allowing for King Gellir's subsequent conquests. And though the Dwemer reclaimed most of their lands a century later, there is no evidence that they ever resumed their research on Aetherium. Perhaps the costs had just been too great. [pagebreak] But nothing like the Aetherium Forge described in the inscriptions has ever been found within the borders of Skyrim. It may have been destroyed long ago, by the Nord invaders or the Dwemer themselves. Or perhaps it, like the secrets of Aetherium itself, still remains to be discovered.
string:
[pagebreak]

神光水晶之战 卡提雅 金斯利著 (修订第二版) 献给 , 我最亲爱的朋友和拯救者 由格威林分部出版于独孤城

[pagebreak]

前言

以此公告全泰姆瑞尔，我， 亲眼目睹了所叙之事，此为正式声明。 泰荣·德莱瑟，自封的作者，其早前出版的一本著作与您现在手中的这本书同名，他是个可耻的背刺骗子、小偷和恶毒之人，除了使人厌恶之外别无可言。 这本书真正的合法作者是卡提雅·金斯利，一位受人尊敬的锻莫建筑和历史学者，她花了20年的时间研究尘封的旧典籍中所有隐藏的线索，以寻找神光水晶熔炉的位置。 不幸的是，卡提雅在阿肯撒兹的一场地震中坠亡。我就是在那里遇到了她现形的幽灵，她告诉了我德雷瑟的背叛，他窃取了她的作品，并虚假地以自己的名义将其出版。 凭借卡提雅关于神光水晶的精湛知识，我们共同找到了神光水晶碎片，而这使我们最终找到了锻莫真正的神光水晶熔炉。 最重要的是，我们创造了一个神光水晶神器，作为我现在携有的证据。卡提雅才值得所有这些赞扬，因为我所做的部分只是提供了一个躯体，让她可以与这个世界互动。 她的幽魂显灵和短暂陪伴却能让她像老朋友一般地使人舒适，为此，深切怀念。

[pagebreak]

The Aetherium Wars

[pagebreak]

he end, when it came, was swift. In the span of three short years, the great dwarven cities of Skyrim, from Markarth to the Velothi Mountains, fell before the armies of the High King. Cities that had held fast against the Nords for over a hundred years crumbled abruptly and without warning. For centuries, scholars have marveled at the sudden collapse of the Dwemer city-states. Even the Nords seem to have been taken by surprise, though their chroniclers were quick to ascribe their success to King Gellir's inspired tactics and the blessings of Shor. My research suggests a much different cause, however. In the decades preceding their fall, the dwarven cities of Skyrim had been decimated by internal disputes and infighting over a most surprising cause: Aetherium. Modern scholars know Aetherium as a rare, luminescent blue crystal found in some Dwemer ruins. Most consider it little more than a curiosity, as it has proven all but impossible to work with: while it has a strong magical aura, it is alchemically inert, and no known process can enchant, smelt, mold, bind, or break it. [pagebreak] To the dwarves, of course, such problems were merely a challenge. In the years following King Harald's reign, the Dwemer discovered a considerable source of Aetherium in their deepest delvings. An alliance of four cities, led by Arkngthamz, the great research center in the southern Reach, was formed to oversee its extraction, processing, and study, and a new 'Aetherium Forge' constructed to smelt it under precisely controlled conditions. If the inscriptions I discovered are to be believed, the results were nothing short of spectacular: the items produced by the Forge were artifacts of immense power, imbued from the moment of their creation with powerful enchantments. The dwarven alliance shattered almost immediately, as the four city-states and their rivals attempted to claim the Forge. [pagebreak] We can only speculate that none were successful. Decades of conflict merely weakened them all, allowing for King Gellir's subsequent conquests. And though the Dwemer reclaimed most of their lands a century later, there is no evidence that they ever resumed their research on Aetherium. Perhaps the costs had just been too great. [pagebreak] But nothing like the Aetherium Forge described in the inscriptions has ever been found within the borders of Skyrim. It may have been destroyed long ago, by the Nord invaders or the Dwemer themselves. Or perhaps it, like the secrets of Aetherium itself, still remains to be discovered.

original: Kara's Letter to Katria
string: 卡拉致卡提雅的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>
My dear Katria, 

Going by your last letter to me, I trust that you're in good health and spirit both. I am simply in awe of your commitment to your work researching dwemer architecture and history. Truly, your sense of duty you get from your mother, Kaetlynn, my sister. While obviously you get your desire for exploration and survival skills from your father Uhtred. Stendarr rest both their souls. 

Did your mother ever tell you, she overheard Ulfric telling some of his men, he thought your father could be the Shezarrine of the 4th era? This reverie of Ulfric's quite possibly lead to your father's death. I know Uhtred was an exceptional warrior, and then some, but he wasn't the Shezarrine no more than he was the Dragonborn. I curse Ulfric for using Uhtred as the right hand of the divines,  constantly placing your father in the most difficult conflicts imaginable. Your mother used to tell me that Uhtred had a knack for beating the odds until the bitter end in that Markarth Incident. Apologies Katria, I know you loved your father and that his demise under Ulfric disturbs you, as it should. 

I remember the letter from you mother telling me that she had finally had enough of the Stormcloaks, the civil war and Ulfric. She wanted nothing to do with that life after she lost your father. She only wanted to be close to your father's spirit and could only imagine that place to be where he finally fell in battle. It was the whole reason behind her move to Markarth. Even though your father would have been furious about the notion. She told me she was killing two birds with one stone. She said, on one hand, she believed she could feel Uhtred's presence in Markarth, while on the other hand, what better way was there to escape, than to live amongst Ulfric's enemies. It was a shame really, but I could not talk her out of it. 

Living in Markarth, she thought it best to drop your fathers surname Beinbroti and return to using her maiden name of Kingsley to remain hidden from the Stormcloaks and Ulfric's influence. She knew all too well that Ulfric too, would be extremely putout to learn the spouse of his former Bonebreaker was in self exile in Markarth. 

Ulfric was unwise to exhaust your father's reserves in his exploits. Your father deserved better then Ulfric, he was a true Nord hero. But I digress, these are matters you are already well aware of. 

So, did you finally clear out all the cobwebs in that hidden shrine to Talos your mother 'claimed' she found. I know my sister and when she's fabricating a story for me. You can tell me Katria, I wont let it come back on you. Well anyway, if true, Stendarr knows, if it's as big as you say, your father would have loved that shrine were he still alive. Your mother told me once she thought the chambers might have been used for something else, something older. Who, in their right mind, would have paid a hadsome commission to have it built in the first place, and in an old Dwemer Pump Station no less? It's absolutely insane, the person must have been flat out stupid drunk. 

...Speaking of which, now that I've brought it up writing about it, this makes me wonder if it wasn't your mother afterall, on a bender, trying to honor your father's memory some how. She missed Uhtred so very much, I know that's why she drank herself into Oblivion. To cope with despression, it was clearly the death of her. After all these years, I'm still so sorry Katria, that I couldn't have done more for your mother, my sister... so sad... 

On another topic, have you had any recent luck in your search for that mysterous dwemer forge? I do love hearing about your delvings and spelunking into those ancient dwemer ruins. Although I have to admit there's an overwhelming sense of anxiety reading your letters. Weirdly addictive as well. But then I always simply love hearing from you Katria. Please write back soon I await with anticipation.

With sincere Love and adoration, your aunt Kara
</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont"><font size='15'>
​​致亲爱的卡提雅：

看了你上次的来信，知道你现在身体和精神状态都不错，我就放心啦！你研究锻莫建筑和历史的那股认真劲儿，简直跟你妈凯特琳（我那个倔妹妹）一模一样。至于你那爱冒险的性子嘛，肯定是遗传自你爸乌特雷德。愿斯坦达尔保佑他们的灵魂。

你的妈妈跟你说过没？她曾亲耳听见乌弗瑞克跟手下吹嘘，说你爸可能是第四纪元的谢尔格拉化身。就因为这荒唐念头，害得你爸送了命。我知道乌特雷德是个了不起的战士，但他既不是什么神选者，更不是龙裔。我诅咒乌弗瑞克把你爸当"神之右手"使唤，总把他往最危险的战场上推。你妈常说，你爸总能在绝境中创造奇迹，直到马卡斯事件那次...抱歉提起这些，卡提雅，我知道你有多爱你爸，也理解你对乌弗瑞克的恨意。

我还记得你妈妈写给我的那封信，说她终于受够了风暴斗篷、内战和乌弗瑞克。失去你父亲后，她再也不想和那种生活有任何瓜葛。她只想离你父亲的灵魂近一些，觉得只有在他战死的地方才能感受到他的存在。这就是她搬去马卡斯的全部原因。虽然你父亲要是知道了肯定会大发雷霆。她说这是一举两得：一方面她相信在马卡斯能感受到乌特雷德的存在，另一方面，还有什么比躲在乌弗瑞克的敌人堆里更好的藏身之处呢？虽然我觉得很遗憾，但实在劝不动她。

住在马卡斯那会儿，她觉得最好让你改回她的娘家姓金斯莱，这样既能避开风暴斗篷的耳目，又能躲开乌弗瑞克的影响。她太清楚了——要是让那家伙知道他昔日的"碎骨者"之妻，如今竟自我放逐到敌营马卡斯，非得气炸肺不可！

乌弗瑞克不明智地耗尽了你父亲的精力在他的征战中。你父亲值得比乌弗瑞克更好的对待，他是个真正的诺德英雄。不过我离题了，这些事情你都再清楚不过了。

对了，你妈妈"偶然发现"的那个塔洛斯密室，蜘蛛网扫干净没？我了解我妹妹，她编故事给我听的时候是什么样子。你可以告诉我实情，卡提雅，我不会说出去的。好吧，如果那是真的，斯坦达尔知道，如果它真像你说的那么大，你父亲要是还活着一定会喜欢的。你母亲曾跟我说过，她认为那个密室可能曾被用作其他用途，更古老的用途。哪个神志清醒的人会花大价钱在一个老旧的锻莫泵站里建造这种东西？这简直太疯狂了，那人一定是喝得烂醉如泥。

...说到这个，既然都写到这儿了，我不禁怀疑：该不会真是你母亲某次喝高了，想用这种方式纪念你父亲吧？她太想念乌特雷德了，我知道这就是她酗酒至死的原因。为了逃避抑郁，这显然要了她的命。这么多年过去了，卡提雅，我还是很抱歉没能为你母亲——我的妹妹——多做些什么...太令人难过了...

换个话题，你最近在找那个神秘的锻莫熔炉有什么进展吗？我超爱听你讲探索那些古老锻莫遗迹的故事。不过说实话，每次看你的信都让我提心吊胆的，但又莫名上瘾。总之我就是特别喜欢收到你的消息，卡提雅。快点回信啊，我都等不及了！

​​永远爱你的姨母 卡拉​
</font>

original: Don't know anyone here doesn't have Rattles or Ataxia.

original: The Empire didn't think we could take the Reach, but here we are.
string: 帝国以为我们拿不下瑞驰，但我们成功了。

string: 看看那些风暴斗篷能不能闯进这峡谷。

original: Outsiders aren't trusted in Markarth. Best keep that in mind.
string: 外人在马卡斯不受信任。记住这一点。

original: Can't believe I'm posted here. Even the beds are made of stone.
string: 真不敢相信我会到这里。连床都是石头做的。

original: You should see that Orc over in Understone Keep, have him forge you some new armor...
string: 你应该去看看石下要塞那个兽人，让他给你锻造些新盔甲。

original: This is Markarth, traveler. Safest city in the Reach.
string: 旅行者，这里是马卡斯，全瑞驰最安全的城市。

original: You here to see the Jarl? No sudden moves, understand?
string: 你是来见领主的？不要太冒失，懂吗？

original: Whole dwarven city underneath the keep. Nchuand-Zel. Best steer clear if you don't want a Steam Centurion carving you up.

original: I could have a wedding at the temple?
string: 我可以在神庙里举行婚礼吗？

original: Yes. If you were ready, of course. Are you familiar with how marriage works in Skyrim?
string: 是啊，准备好了的话当然没问题。你对天际的婚姻习俗了解吗？

original: Tell me about Mara's Temple. (Vanilla)
string: 我想要进一步了解玛拉神殿。

original: Wonderful. Where to begin?
string: 太好了。从哪里开始说呢？

original: Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost.
string: 玛拉是爱之女神。神庙会通过周济病患、穷人和迷途者来传播她的恩赐。

original: We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples in Skyrim.
string: 我们还为全天际相爱的情侣举办婚礼。

original: And now... I think I can rest. Farewell, my friend, wherever your travels take you.
string: 而现在……我想可以休息了。无论你的旅途向何方，永别了，我的朋友。

string: 卫兵！杀了她！

original: Your crown... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: 你的王冠……神啊，是神光水晶造的！纯神光水晶！

original: Your staff... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: 你的法杖……神啊，是神光水晶造的！纯神光水晶！

original: Your shield... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: 你的盾牌……神啊，是神光水晶造的！纯神光水晶！

original: Katria? No, no that's not possible!
string: 卡提雅？不，那不可能！

original: You... you know too much. I can't afford to let you live.
string: 你……你知道的太多了。我可不能让你活下去了。

original: I had some help. From Katria.
string: 我得到了些帮助，从卡提雅那里。

original: I've heard of you. From Katria.
string: 我听说过你，从卡提雅那里。

original: I made it.
string: 我成功了。

original: What? You... you found the Forge? The Aetherium Forge?
string: 什么？你……你找到了锻炉？神光水晶锻炉？

original: Really? You had to take the armor? Come on, leave me with a little dignity...
string: 真的吗？你要拿走这副盔甲？拜托了，给我留点尊严吧……

original: Wait, a minute... Are you being perverse? Why are you gawking at my naked corpse!?
string: 等等...你是在变态吗？为什么盯着我的裸尸看！？

original: I mean... I'm not sure if I should feel flattered or disgusted. Look at it... with that pallor and being desiccated like that... it's awful.
string: 我是说...不知道该感到荣幸还是恶心。看着它...那种惨白的颜色，干瘪的样子...太可怕了。

original: Please tell me you're not so immorally depraved as to defile my corpse. I'm going to pretend I never saw this.
string: 请告诉我你不会道德沦丧到亵渎我的尸体。我会假装没看见这一幕。

original: I wonder... In this moment, are you revealing your underlying, genuine nature? You are a naughty person, aren't you?
string: 我在想...此刻你是否暴露了本性？你是个下流胚子，对吧？

original: Oh look! A fight! Five gold on the big one!
string: 来啊！混蛋！

original: Ouch! I bet that hurt - You're gonna be sorry for that.
string: 你会后悔的！

original: Come on! Kick Ass! My Great-grandma fights better than you, and she's probably a damn Draugr by now! How pathetic, what a Looser!
string: 我的曾祖母打得也比你厉害……她现在可能已经是个尸鬼了都！

original: Umm... are you going to keep that?
string: 嗯...你要留着那个吗？

original: That's not fair!... I saw it first!
string: 这不公平！……是我先看到的！

original: Oh no... a Poor dead Khajiit... they don't get any respect in Skyrim... except from Skooma dealers... so sad...
string: 哦不...可怜的已死虎人...他们在天际省得不到任何尊重...除了斯库玛贩子...真可悲...

original: Oh my!... look, a dead piece of trash Thalmor... I bet they pissed off the wrong Nord who was fed up with Altmer Arrogance... always trying to dictate which divines can be worship while omitting others, like Talos. Good riddance I say.
string: 天呐！...看啊，一具死掉的梭默垃圾...我打赌他们惹毛了某个受够精灵傲慢的诺德人...总想规定哪些神明能拜却不许拜塔洛斯。死得好。

original: I know what thats like... to just lay there and watch you body decay... it sucks.
string: 我知道那是种什么感觉...只能躺在那里，看着你自己的躯体渐渐腐烂...

original: I know what that's like... to just lay there and watch people rammage through your corpse taking what they want, hoping they'll leave you with some dignity... it sucks.
string: 我懂那种感觉...就躺在那儿看着人们翻弄你的尸体拿走想要的东西，还指望他们能给你留点尊严...糟透了。

original: Oh my! Sucks to be you... I should know I've got experience being a corpse..
string: 天啊！糟透了...早该意识到我有过当尸体的经验..

original: Alright then...
string: 那好吧...

original: Okay...
Until next time...
string: 下次见...再见...

original: Alright then... later.
string: 好吧，那以后再说吧……

original: Okay... later then.
string: 好吧...回头见。

original: Excuse me... but don't I know you from some where?
string: 不好意思...我认识你吗？

original: Hello... name is Katria... Explorer, Scholar of Dwemer Culture and Architechture and Master Archer, at your service.
string: 你好...我叫卡提雅...探险家、学者和弓术大师，乐意为您效劳。

original: Hello...
string: 你好...

original: Yes? What is it?
string: 啊？什么？

original: Hello... what can I do for you?
string: 你好，需要帮忙吗？

original: What can I do for you?
string: 我能为你做什么吗？

original: What is it? What do you need, my friend?
string: 怎么了？需要什么吗，朋友？

original: Yes? What do you need?
string: 嗯？您有什么吩咐？

original: Yes? Can I help you with something?
string: 嗯，我能帮上什么吗？ ?

original: Yes? Is there something you need?
string: 嗯？有什么需要？

original: Hello, my Lord... Is there something you need?
string: 您好，大人...有何吩咐？

original: Hello, Lord Ysmir... Is there something you need?
string: 您好，伊斯米尔大人...有何吩咐？

original: Hello... What can I do for the Dragonborn?
string: 你好...我能为龙裔做些什么？

original: Hello... What can I do for the Dragonborn today?
string: 你好...今天我能为龙裔效劳吗？

original: Hello darling... What can I do for you my Lord Dragonborn?
string: 亲爱的...我能为您做什么，我的龙裔大人？

original: Hello darling... What can I do for you Ysmir of the North, my Lord Dragonborn?
string: 亲爱的...我能为您做什么，北境的伊斯米尔，我的龙裔大人？

original: Hello, my love... What can I do for the mighty Dragonborn today?
string: 你好，亲爱的...今天我能为强大的龙裔做些什么？

original: How can I help the Thane of Markarth?
string: 我能为马卡斯城的领主做些什么？

original: How can I help the Thane of Whiterun?
string: 我能为白漫城的领主做些什么？

original: How can I help the Thane of both Markarth and Whiterun?
string: 我能为马卡斯与白漫的双料领主做些什么？

original: You know... you should proably put some clothes on before you freeze to death.
string: 你应该穿些衣服，在冻死之前...

original: By the gods! You 'are' perverse aren't you?
string: 天哪，你有点变态了，不是吗？

original: Oh... would you look at that... I didn't know that perversity is a skill.
string: 哦...我还不知道，变态也能是一种技能。

original: Ok, now we can add  exhibitionist to your list of skills...
string: 好的，现在我们可以将暴露癖好添加到你的技能树中了...

original: Ok, now that you've shown me your delicates... are you a happy exhibitionist now?
string: 好吧，既然你给我看了你的内衣……你的变态欲望现在满足了吗？

original: Ummm... You may look good in jail rags, but on the contrary, I don't. So, can we go now?
string: 呃...你穿囚服可能挺好看，但我可不行。我们现在能走了吗？

original: Ummm and we're sneaking why? Ohh, I get it, because we don't belong here, right!? ...Oh, you weren't aware my name was also Captain Obvious? hahaha
string: 你知道我们不应该待在这里……对吧？

original: Ummm... You know we shouldn't be in here... right?
string: 好...让我们出发吧！

original: Okay, can we go now - you do know there are other ways to be naughty, right?
string: 好了，我们走吧！

original: Ummm... we came and we've seen the place, so it's time to go - yes?
string: 我们该出发咯！

original: Ok... we need to talk about your archery.
string: 好的...我们要谈谈你的箭术。

original: Umm... try straightening your back just a bit... lift your head higher, bring the bow up to meet your aim. Yup... that's it!
string: 嗯...试着稍微挺直你的背部...把头抬得更高，拉弓对准。是的...就是这样！

original: Do you want me to show you how it's done? I promise I wont laugh... hahaha.
string: 你想让我展示给你看这是怎么完成的？我保证我不会笑的...

original: When you shout... I feel a warm aura inside me - it makes my spirits soar, and I don't know why, maybe it's Kyne's grace - but I like it!
string: 当你发出那吼声时...我在内心感到温暖和兴奋，不知道为什么！..

original: Oh my! To witness Kyne's Thu'um... is truly breath taking!
string: 凯娜之息啊.. 能见证它真是令人振奋！

original: By the gods! When you shout like that I can feel it vibrate inside me!
string: 当你像龙一样怒吼时，我能感觉到你体内的力量！..

original: Stendarr's mercy... That shout gave me goose bumps!
string: 斯坦达尔的仁慈啊……那龙吼让我浑身起鸡皮疙瘩！

original: Home sweet home... Oh shit!.. Look at all the cobwebs in here... by the gods how long was I dead!?
string: 家，甜蜜的家……哦该死的！……这里那么多的蜘蛛网……天啊，我已经死了多久了！？

original: This place looks like a haunted house now!.. It's gonna take forever to clean all these damn cobwebs out of here...
string: 这地方现在看起来像个鬼屋！……要清理走所有这些该死的蜘蛛网怕是需要到猴年马月……

original: You must think I'm a poor housekeeper... what with all these cobwebs and all... I assure you I'm really not.
string: 你一定觉得我是个不会打理房子的人……有这么多蜘蛛网，还有那么多……我向你保证，我真不是不会……

original: Ohh crap... I'm really not in the mood to do house cleaning today... how about we go over to your place instead?..
string: 好吧……我今天真没有打扫房间的心情……不如我们去你家，怎么样？……

original: Amazing! If I'm correct, this is the location of the ancient Alftand Glacial Dwemer Ruins. It's a renowned Dwemer city with an Animonculory where their craftsman created their Dwemer constructs. Are we going in? Awesome!
string: 太棒了！如果没记错，这里是古阿尔夫坦德冰川锻莫遗址。著名的锻莫城市，有着制造构装体的动画工坊。我们要进去吗？妙极了！

original: Fable has it this is also the location of a Dwemer Cathedral. An vertical access point to a more or less mythological large Dwemer city, called Fal'Zhardum Din.
string: 传说这里还有座锻莫大教堂。通往神话般的巨型锻莫城市法尔·扎尔杜姆的垂直入口。

original: This must be the Alftand Animonculory. This is where the Dwemer created their Animunculi, or Dwemer Constructs, like the Dwarven Spider, Dwarven Sphere, and their damn Centurions.
string: 这里肯定是艾尔夫坦德机械坊。锻莫在此制造动画构装体，比如矮人蜘蛛、矮人球体，还有该死的百夫长。

original: You remember? It was that huge formidable golem we fought together in the Aetherium Forge, while I was a ghost. Damn thing was hard to kill. They're all made of Dwarven metal and were primarily used as fearsome War Machines as well as guards.
string: 记得吗？就是我们在神光水晶锻炉一起对抗的那个巨型魔像，当时我还是幽灵。那玩意儿难对付得很。它们都用矮人金属打造，主要用作战争机器和守卫。

original: Look there, in the center of the chamber. That must be the Dwarven Mechanism that provides access to Blackreach. But I've no clue where to even begin looking for some attunement sphere thingy.
string: 看那儿，大厅中央。肯定是通往黑降的矮人机关。但我完全不知道从哪找那个什么调谐球体。

original: Damned things are very difficult to kill!
string: 这些该死的玩意儿真难杀！

original: Hey!!! Wait up!!!
string: 喂！！！等等我！！！

original: Hey!!! Wait for me!!!
string: 喂！！！等我一下！！！

original: Hold up!!! Wait for me!!!
string: 停下！！！等我！！！

original: Hey! - Wait for me! Let me catch up!
string: 嘿！- 等等！让我跟上！

original: Hey! - Wait up! Dont' leave me Dovahkiin! I don't have your stamina... wish I did.
string: 嘿！- 别丢下我啊龙裔！我没你那样的体力...真希望有。

original: You've put on an Amulet of Mara?!. so you're finally looking for a mate... Not to sound overzealous, but... I've already said that you're pleasant company and You do know that I'm available right?
string: 你戴上了玛拉护符？！。所以你终于决定要找一个伴侣了对吧... 我不想显得自作多情，但是... 我确实说过你是一个令人愉快的同伴，而且你知道我正好单身对吧？

original: Ohhh... So this is the village of Riverwood... it's absolutely adorable... sitting on a river running through a valley... its just beautiful... very idyllic indeed.
string: 哦...所以这就是河木镇...它真是可爱，绝对的...坐落在一条流经山谷的河流上...它非常美丽...像田园诗歌一般的氛围。

original: Oh-kay... as towns go, Falkreath looks nice and quaint... I like the way it's nestled in these forested mountains. Let's hope the people are nice too...
string: 哦，好吧……在去了那么多城镇后，佛克瑞斯依然看起来漂亮又古朴……我喜欢它就这么地依偎在这些覆盖着森林的山脉中。希望当地人也会很棒...

original: I've read there's a renowned old forge from antiquity here in Whiterun called a Skyforge. By all accounts weapons crafted from it are the best. I hear these days the technique is held solely by an old Nord whose name is Yorlund Grey-Mane.
string: 我读到过，白漫城是古代著名的天空熔炉所在的地方……据说这里制造的武器是最好的……但这项技艺只有厄伦德·灰鬃能做到。

original: Would you look at these Aspens they are absolutely gorgeous... Simply beautiful... My aunt Kara wasn't exaggerating... I hope the rest of the Rift is this beautiful too... What a delight...
string: 看看这些白杨树吧，绝对的华丽……简直美呆了……我的卡拉阿姨没有夸大其词……我希望裂谷的其他地方也会这么漂亮……这景色多么令人高兴啊……

original: ARKNGTHAMZ! Really!? You know DAMN well I died in there? Why would you want to come back here? As if the Earthquakes and tremors aren't bad enough, there are traps galore, Falmer and their Chaurus pets, and deadly Dwemer machinations!
string: 阿肯撒兹!.. 你认真？天杀的，你知道我曾经死在里面过吗？你为什么要回到那里？要是地震和裂口还不够糟糕，里面还有大量的陷阱、伐莫和他们的巢蚁宠物......以及致命的矮人机械体......

original: Seriously!? You know I'm against this, but I'll follow you back in here. It'll surely be a test of the sincerity of my vow to follow you to the ends of the world. Just know going forward that Arkngthamz will creep me out forevermore!
string: 虽然我反对这么做，但我还是会跟你去的……这肯定是对我发誓跟随你到世界尽头的真挚考验……只管前进，向阿肯撒兹！ .. 虽然我永远对它心有余悸。

original: Bthardamz - One of the few Dwemer ruins I've not ventured to explore, due to being overrun by the poor souls of the afflicted. I'm not one to chance proximity with the disease if I can help it.
string: 巴萨姆兹 - 少数我没敢探索的锻莫遗迹，因为到处都是可怜的枯萎者。只要有可能，我绝不冒险靠近那种疾病。

original: With Bthardamz now cleared, I can come back later when we're not attending to other matters and thoroughly explore it properly and take notes for a book.
string: 既然巴萨姆兹清理干净了，等我们处理完其他事可以回来好好探索，为我的书做笔记。

original: Deep Folk Crossing - Formerly Bthar-zel, by the Dwemer. I could never find its entrance - I suspect it may've been similar to the entrance of Ba'thalft where one would need a mechanism to raise the Dwemer lift from within a hidden structure.
string: 深民十字路 - 锻莫语叫巴萨-泽尔。我一直找不到入口 - 怀疑可能像巴尔撒夫特那样需要机关从隐藏建筑里启动矮人升降梯。

original: Oh! We're revisiting Raldb'thar? ...Okay, I'm game. Perhaps we'll find some hidden lore, or better yet, some undiscovered Aetherium - Wouldn't that be grand?
string: 哦！我们要重访拉德巴撒？...好吧，我加入。说不定能找到隐藏知识，或者更好的 - 未发现的神光？那不就太棒了？

original: When I was just a teenage girl still, Calcelmo's nephew Aicantar, brought me to Winterhold to join the college here. I was amazed to see it for the first time. But I also remember being scared to death to cross its cracked and broken great bridge.
string: 当我的父母把我带到冬堡，让我加入这里的学院时，我只是一个十几岁的女孩……第一次看到它时我感到非常震撼……但我也记得，穿过那有着裂痕和断口的大桥时，我害怕得要死...

original: The College of Winterhold is not just an amazing sight. It's also where I learned about the history of the Dwemerfolk, their marvelous architecture, wonderous constructs - and all the dangers of such topics.
string: 冬堡学院不仅仅是一个奇特的景观....它也是我学习矮人历史、他们奇妙的建筑学、神奇的构造学......以及此中所有危险之处的地方......

original: The Frozen Hearth Inn - except for its current patrons, this place hasn't changed at all since my last visit - it's like it's frozen in time from the great collapse. That happened 79 years ago, can you believe it?
string: 冻炉客栈...除了现在的顾客不同了...自我上次造访以来这个地方没有任何变化...它就像是自79年前大崩溃发生后时间就冻结了一样...

original: I grew up in Markarth, and as a child, I always marveled at the wondrous architecture of Dwemer ruins. They held such great mystery for me, and I believe that's what spurred my desire for exploration.
string: 我在马卡斯城长大......小时候，我总是惊叹于矮人废墟建筑的奇妙......它们对我来说是一个巨大的谜团，激发了我探索的欲望...

original: If you want me to share what historical details I know... just ask.
string: 如果你想让我分享些我所知道的历史故事……尽管问就好。

original: Reachwind Eyrie... while impressive to look at... it's merely a Dwemer tower ruin and a local landmark here in the mountains of The Reach... it overlooks the Karth River valley, south-east of Markarth... otherwise, it's of no particular interest...
string: 临风鹰巢...虽然看起来令人印象深刻...但它只是边塞领山区的一座矮人废墟塔和当地的地标...它俯瞰着马卡斯城东南部的卡斯河谷...除此之外，没什么特别有趣的地方...

original: I often think about beautiful places I'd like to visit. My mother always raved about the beauty of Camlorn in High Rock. And now, after my aunt Kara had me brought there and I've seen it with my own eyes, I understand why mother loved it so.
string: 我的思绪飘向我想去的地方……主要是我听说过的那些美丽之地。我母亲以前常常谈论高岩那美丽的卡姆伦城，我还没有去过那里……也许有一天……

original: Speaking of places I'd like to visit - I recall when I was a little girl my aunt Kara would debate at length with my mother that the Aspens in the Rift around Lake Honric are vastly more beautiful than those in the Glenumbra region of High Rock.
string: 说到我想去的地方……我记得当我还是个小女孩的时候，我母亲的妹妹，我的阿姨卡拉会和我母亲争论很久，说在霍利奇湖周边，裂谷领中的白杨树要美丽得多……

original: While not Dwemer related at all, I've heard of a forgotten vale, hidden deep in the Northwestern peaks of Haafingar mountains and the Western Reach of High Rock - it's supposed to be a beautiful location if it can be found.
string: 虽然与矮人没什么关系，但我听说过有一个遗忘山谷，隐藏在海芬加山脉西北部和高岩西部之中的山峰深处...如果能找到它，那应该是一个美丽的地方...

original: Hey! What's all this talk about Azura's statue being a sight to see... I've seen it and wasn't all that impressed. Sure it's huge, colossal even - but really, it's only a damn statue - in fact, the only thing impressive about it is it's antiquity.
string: 说阿祖拉雕像是什么值得一看的景象，只是废话而已……我看过它，也没留下什么深刻的印象……当然它很大，很巨大……但说真的，它只是个该死的雕像。 .. 事实上，它唯一给人的印象的是老旧......

original: Home sweet home - or it used to be. I still find Markarth beautiful, though I'll admit that I'm probably biased because of my love for Dwemer architecture.
string: 家，甜蜜的家...或者曾经是...我仍然觉得马卡斯城很漂亮...虽然我不得不承认，这话可能只是因为我对矮人建筑的热爱而产生的偏见...

original: Uhmmm - I've something I've been wanting to tell you - and don't know exactly how to say it - so I'm just going to put it out there, and hopefully, without blushing - you truly are attractive.
string: 嗯……我有件事一直想告诉你……但我不知道怎么说……所以我就直说了……你真的很有魅力。

original: Oooo look, ancient dwemer architecture!... I love this particular type of ruins... except for the natural dangers, or the natural ass holes trying to lay claim... they're full of wonders...
string: 哦哦哦，看啊，古老的矮人建筑！...我喜欢这种特殊的废墟...不管那些天然的危险和宣称占有了它的混蛋们...它充满了奇迹...

original: Ancient Dwemer ruins - Don't you find it odd there are no Dwemer tombs? Just like the race, none are known to exist.
string: 古老的矮人遗迹...你觉得我们会找到一座矮人墓穴吗？...那就和他们自己一样，没有一个能确认他们还存在着。

original: More ancient Dwemer ruins. You know, I'm still astonished at how some ruins have been amazingly renovated and function as modern settlements, just like Markarth.
string: 太棒了...古老的矮人遗迹...你知道，我仍然对一些遗迹怎样被惊人地翻新并作为现代定居点使用而感到惊讶，比如马卡斯城。

original: Oh, look! more Ancient Dwemer ruins. Too bad these days they're primarily occupied by ugly Falmer, the inflicted, bandits, or even vampires living in them. Or worse, all the above.

original: Dwemer ruins... I keep optimistically hoping to discover something new - I'd like to write about it in a new book - providing we survive and it doesn't kill us. Been there, and done that already.

original: Markarth translates as "Above the Karth", also known as the City of Stone... it's one of the nine major cities in the province of Skyrim, and it's the capital of the Reach.
string: 马卡斯城翻译为“卡斯之上”，它也被称为石头之城……它是天际省的九个主要城市之一，也是边塞领的首府。

original: Markarth has held vast significance in the Reach, being claimed from the Reachmen to the Nords... Markarth was built from the ruins of Nchuand-Zel, which has been re-purpissed into the modern city...
string: 马卡斯对于边塞来说有着巨大的意义，边塞人和诺德人都宣称这是属于他们的。马卡斯城是在楚安德-泽尔的废墟上建造的，它已经被改造成现代城市了。

original: It is known for its rich silver mines that use convicts for labor, which are mostly owned by the influential Silver-Bloods family...
string: 它以其丰富的银矿而闻名，这些银矿大多由这里最有影响力的银血家族所有。

original: The renowned cutthroat intreag that's surrounding Markarth's silver-producing industry, popularized the local saying... "Blood and silver are what flows through Markarth...."
string: 围绕着火星与白银的生产工业伴随着它们著名的残酷入侵，就像当地人的说法一样……"从马卡斯流出来的只有血和银...."

original: The city is located in the far western mountains of The Reach, and west of the Karth River... As a result, the city has a good natural defense, even from the skies...
string: 这座城市位于边塞领的西部山脉，卡斯河以西。因此，即使是从天上来说，这个城市也拥有着很好的天然防御屏障……
